VirtualBox is generally on par with Vmware workstation for me.
I haven't installed Windows in it, I have no need and I lack a license.

it's free as in beer and most is GPL, there are some proprietary things though, that's just USB support and something else, but that's also free as in beer, so you can just download the ubuntu edgy package.

one thing you'll need to do, that confused me a little, is you need to add yourself to a group it creates when it installs, then logout and back in, then restart it by running "VirtualBox shutdown" in the terminal, then starting it from the menu again. Otherwise it doesn't have permission for you... but it's really simple to do, infact, here is a link: http://virtualbox.org/wiki/User_FAQ <-= It's the top Linux users one.
click the link for the virtual CD drive, add an ISO image to the disk manager and choose it from the drop down menu, for physical devices I don't think you have to add anything.
I don't know, I never had that problem, when you start the VM, try pressing f12 so you can choose which device to boot.
